name: Indonesia
introduction: The Dutch began to colonize Indonesia in the early 17th century; Japan occupied the islands from 1942 to 1945. Indonesia declared its independence shortly before Japan's surrender but it required four years of sometimes brutal fighting intermittent negotiations and UN mediation before the Netherlands agreed to transfer sovereignty in 1949. A period of sometimes unruly parliamentary democracy ended in 1957 when President SOEKARNO declared martial law and instituted \"Guided Democracy.\" After an abortive coup in 1965 by alleged communist sympathizers SOEKARNO was gradually eased from power. From 1967 until 1988 President SUHARTO ruled Indonesia with his \"New Order\" government. After rioting toppled SUHARTO in 1998 free and fair legislative elections took place in 1999. Indonesia is now the world's third most populous democracy the world's largest archipelagic state and the world's largest Muslim-majority nation. Current issues include: alleviating poverty improving education preventing terrorism consolidating democracy after four decades of authoritarianism implementing economic and financial reforms stemming corruption reforming the criminal justice system holding the military and police accountable for human rights violations addressing climate change and controlling infectious diseases particularly those of global and regional importance. In 2005 Indonesia reached a historic peace agreement with armed separatists in Aceh which led to democratic elections in Aceh in December 2006. Indonesia continues to face low intensity armed resistance in Papua by the separatist Free Papua Movement.
overview: 'Indonesia a Southeast Asian nation made up of thousands of volcanic islands is home to hundreds of ethnic groups speaking many different languages. It’s known for beaches volcanoes Komodo dragons and jungles sheltering elephants orangutans and tigers. On the island of Java lies Indonesia''s vibrant sprawling capital Jakarta and the city of Yogyakarta known for gamelan music and traditional puppetry.'

languages.area: West Kalimantan Province, near Sarawak border, Balaikarangan, Kembayan, Landak River area.

languages.name: Mendalam Kayan
languages.area: West Kalimantan Province, northeast of Putus Sibau, Mendalam River.

languages.name: Kereho
languages.area: West Kalimantan Province, far east Kapuas Hulu Regency, near Sarawak border, Kereho River.

languages.name: Mainstream Kenyah
languages.area: East Kalimantan Province, Malinau Regency, Pimping, Long Setulang, Batu Kajang, Long Uli, Long Belua villages, Kayan, Mahakam, Upper Baram, Bahau, Upper Balui, Malinau, Belayan, and Telen river areas. Also in Malaysia (Sarawak).

languages.name: Kayan River Kayan
languages.area: East Kalimantan Province, Kayan River, 2 areas.

languages.name: Koroni
languages.area: Central Sulawesi, Bungku Tengah subdistrict, Unsongi village on east coast south of Bungku town.

languages.name: Kumbewaha
languages.area: Southeast Sulawesi Province, Buton District, Lasalimu subdistrict, southeast Buton Island, Kumbewaha and Wajah Jaya villages.

languages.name: Kembra
languages.area: Jayawijaya Regency, Okbibab subdistrict, east of Sogber River.

languages.name: Uma' Lasan
languages.area: Balui, Belaga, Kalua, Kemena rivers. Also in Indonesia (Kalimantan).

languages.name: Manado Malay
languages.area: North Sulawesi, Minahasa District, west coast, Manado port area.

languages.name: Matbat
languages.area: Raja Ampat Islands, Misool Island, Segaf Islands.

languages.name: Maden
languages.area: Raja Ampat Islands, west Salawati Island.

languages.name: Mori Bawah
languages.area: Central Sulawesi, southeast peninsula neck; Petasia and Lembo subdistricts, 24 villages, or parts of villages; south Sulawesi.

languages.name: Kokoda
languages.area: Bird’s Head, south coast on Maccluer Gulf, east of Inanwatan.

languages.name: Sempan
languages.area: Middle south coast, between Kokonao and Agats, east of Kamoro [kgq], west of Asmat languages.

languages.name: Ketengban
languages.area: Near Papua New Guinea border, east highland slopes scattered, east of Eipomek [eip] and west of Ngalum [szb].

languages.name: Kwerba Mamberamo
languages.area: East of Mamberamo River, south of Kasonaweja, in mountains above Kwerba, Edifalen, Marinafalen, villages.

languages.name: Ke'o
languages.area: South central Flores, east of Ngad’a, south of Nage, south and southeast of Ebu Lobo volcano. Kecamatans Mauponggo and Nangaroro, Kabupaten Ngada. The Nage forms north border, Ngada is west, and Ende east.

languages.name: Pass Valley Yali
languages.area: Central highlands, east of Angguruk and northwest of Naltya, Jayawijaya, Kurulu, and Kurima.

languages.name: Yetfa
languages.area: Pegunungan Bintang Regency, Okbibab subdistrict, border area east and north of Sobger River, south of Ji Mountain. Also in Papua New Guinea.

languages.name: North Awyu
languages.area: South coast west side of Digul River, south of Kombai [tyn], east of Central Awyu [awu].

languages.name: Yoke
languages.area: Sarmi Regency, east of Warembori east of Mamberamo River, Mantarbori village. Recently moved to coast from interior.

languages.name: Angguruk Yali
languages.area: Central highlands area northwest of Nalca, east of Grand Valley Dani.

languages.name: Yamna
languages.area: Sarmi Regency, Pantai Timur subdistrict, coastal area and an island off north coast, east of Tor River.

languages.name: Yarsun
languages.area: Sarmi Regency, Bonggo subdistrict, Island off north coast east of Biri River.

languages.name: Yue Chinese
languages.area: Guangdong (except Hakka speaking areas northeast, Min Nan-speaking areas east, Hainan Island); Guangxi. Hong Kong and Macau. Also in Australia, Brunei, Canada, Costa Rica, Honduras, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Nauru, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam.

languages.name: Yawa
languages.area: Central Serui Island, Serui Waropen, Serui Selatan, Timur Barat, 8 north coast villages, 2 interior villages, 18 south coast villages.

languages.name: Batui
languages.area: Central Sulawesi Province, Banggai Regency, Batui subdistrict, Balantang, Tolando, Sisipan, Batui villages.

languages.name: Kaimbulawa
languages.area: Southeast Sulawesi, Siompu Island southwest of Baubau. 2 villages.

languages.name: Malay
languages.area: Widespread in Peninsular Malaysia, parts of Sarawak. Also in Canada, Indonesia (Sumatra), Myanmar, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Mairasi
languages.area: Bomberai Peninsula, southwest coast of neck, east and northeast from Kaimana, Wasior, Triton Bay.
